title: bitbollo
author: bitbollo
created_time: April 24, 2023, 11:35:50 AMLast edit: May 01, 2023, 11:26:22 PM by bitbollo
content: Here for auction 8 First Day Cover (FDC) of Cryptoverse ERINNOPHILI STAMPS  (24 April 2023) used in Italy with local Official Postal Service! ONLY 10 items produced - 2 already reserved by authors. (FDC Realized with sheet number 20)Please see below images for reference. Will be auctioned WITHOUT text inside (items opened). Auction detailsBid Format: BTCStarting Bid: 0.0000000 BTC for each lotMinimum Bid Increment: 0.00010000 BTCSniping rule: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time.Additional rule: Since the nature of the object and the possibility that it may be inconvenience with Italian postage (damage, tampering, etc.) I reserve the right to cancel the auction before its expiration or to collect the payments.Auction End Time:  01 May 2023 - 11 PM  (FORUM TIME) // 7 PM (EDT) // [2 May 2023 1 AM (CEST)]Shipping:  On 4-6 May 2023. Tracked/Registered. To be paid by buyers.Payment Address: bc1qm9wnwsgy52jdefvm5g4w72lxqep5d9ks4gq62p or 1BoSH7RisUAPpGfNbX8scSB43YP6Tx3g7M unless using escrow at your expensePayment Due:Within 24 hoursAUCTION TERMSplease bid on item you want buy, there is no difference between covers. Example for bid: Lot X - xxxxx btcFree with all lots : 1 Cryptoverse stamp + top 2 bidders will receive also a block of four!I know just a couple of "private issues" related crypto items used on postal history. This is a unique opportunity to have such a piece in your collection.     Ask here or in private for more details.

comments.author: tweetious
comments.created_time: April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PMLast edit: April 24, 2023, 12:27:50 PM by tweetious
comments.body: a few questions (as usual... lol  )Quote from: bitbollo on April 24, 2023, 11:35:50 AMplease bid on item you want buy, there is no difference between covers. 1) From the photos in the OP, I can see that on the backside of the envelopes, there is a return -handwritten- address  (and on each envelope, there is a mention of a different city). Could you please elaborate on that? We will receive a random envelope?2) If I understood this correctly, you have already posted those envelopes today (24 April 2023), and you are waiting to receive them in the following days? 3) Will we receive an empty opened envelope? ie. you will open the envelope, and remove the inside paper/letter that contains the receiver address?Quote from: bitbollo on April 24, 2023, 11:35:50 AMExample for bid: Lot X - xxxxx btc4) What's the exact bidding format here? If -for example- I would like to place a bid for 3 envelopes. Should I bid 3 @ 0.0001 BTC (LIFO system, since there is no differentiation between covers)ORLot 1: 0.0001 Lot 2: 0.0001 Lot 3: 0.0001 (without knowing exactly what each lot represents...)Quote from: bitbollo on April 24, 2023, 11:35:50 AMAdditional rule: Since the nature of the object and the possibility that it may be inconvenience with Italian postage (damage, tampering, etc.) I reserve the right to cancel the auction before its expiration or to collect the payments.what you mean here is that there is a possibility that you might not receive all/some of the envelopes back, and hence you will be forced to cancel the auction?Edit: since "forum time" might be a lil bit tricky, is it the same ending time as your previous auction? -19:00  (EDT)-

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Ciao tweetious Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PM1) From the photos in the OP, I can see that on the backside of the envelopes, there is a return -handwritten- address  (and on each envelope, there is a mention of a different city). Could you please elaborate on that? We will receive a random envelope?Yes these are random envelopes, not numbered. Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PM2) If I understood this correctly, you have already posted those envelopes today (24 April 2023), and you are waiting to receive them in the following days? Yes correct. That's why I have added "additional rule" (however I had 99,99% items with posta1 have been always delivered properly).Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PM3) Will we receive an empty opened envelope? ie. you will open the envelope, and remove the inside paper/letter that contains the receiver address?Yes correct. Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PM4) What's the exact bidding format here? If -for example- I would like to place a bid for 3 envelopes. Should I bid 3 @ 0.0001 BTC (since there is no differentiation between covers)ORLot 1: 0.0001 Lot 2: 0.0001 Lot 3: 0.0001 (without knowing exactly what each lot represents...)I prefer the second annotation, however also bids placed on first format would be accepted.Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PMwhat you mean here is that there is a possibility that you might not receive all/some of the envelopes back, and hence you will be forced to cancel the auction?Yes correct. Potentially this can be an option even if it's something impossible to happens (with my shop I have never had such problems...)

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.created_time: April 24, 2023, 01:11:16 PMLast edit: April 27, 2023, 09:02:03 PM by bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: tweetious on April 24, 2023, 12:03:10 PMEdit: since "forum time" might be a lil bit tricky, is it the same ending time as your previous auction? -19:00  (EDT)-Right! 19.00 (EDT) // [2 May 2023 1 AM (Roma - Italian Time)]

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: I have taking another look at these and have to say what a great idea it was to send them alongside legit stamps.  Perhaps I should do the same with mine....but the main reason I have not is it would ruin the main artwork on the envelope itself.   I will be following this auction closely as I will for sure at least grab one for my crypto philatelic collection and to alongside my inverted center stamps as well!

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: krogothmanhattan on April 24, 2023, 04:56:23 PM  I have taking another look at these and have to say what a great idea it was to send them alongside legit stamps.  Perhaps I should do the same with mine....but the main reason I have not is it would ruin the main artwork on the envelope itself.   I will be following this auction closely as I will for sure at least grab one for my crypto philatelic collection and to alongside my inverted center stamps as well!Here in Italy these labels have been used very often with stamps. On this site you can see some covers.https://www.francobollitematici.it/filatelia-tematica-francobolli-erinnofilia.phpGenerally speaking, I think that in a crypto-bitcoin thematic collection these labels used for real postage cannot be missing  and here probably with Cryptoverse there is one of the firsts attempts.Consider the general circulations (560 pieces) and those of the postal history (10 pieces) these are hidden gems

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Items received correctly! I can confirm 8 covers are available for the auction. (only one cover is still "on route" so it should be received on the next days).See image below (tracking code are available/not masked). With each label I will provide also print of page with tracking-code and original label/receipt used for shipment. good luck to everyone!Auction end First of May (1 May 2023) at 11 PM Forum time // 19.00 (EDT) // 1 AM (Roma - Italian Time)

comments.body: All items shipped. Please allow some hours and I Will provide tracking code in DM.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on May 06, 2023, 11:16:55 AMAll items shipped. Please allow some hours and I Will provide tracking code in DM.  Bitbollo...received the tracking code...thanks so very much!   Looking forward to adding these stamp gems and unique crypto stamps to my own crypto collection.   Will post and let ya know what I think when I receive!  Keep up the good work!

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Hi Bitbollo....Wanted to let you know I have received the First Day Cover Cryptoverse envelopes!     Love them even better in person...wanted to say also thanks for the extras you added inside!     Keep up the good work...these stamps will long be treasured in my collection!    Cheers
